result.execSummary:
The defendant Shavarr R Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to serve 40 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 40 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shavarr R Patterson

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500 sig bond) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 40 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 40 days time served.  
The court will WAIVE all non-mandatory costs and surcharges.  The court orders defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments, fees and surcharges by 3-15-2016 or a civil judgment is to be entered.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Shavarr R Patterson not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on warrant.  Court ordered the defendant remanded pending sentencing in Branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Entry made without court file.
Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 09/08/2015. Return on warrant scheduled for 09/10/2015 at 8:15am in Branch 38.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case called at 2:07 pm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue.   mld
with all previous conditions continued.   mld

Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.  The Court ordered that the cash bail in the amount of $500.00 is converted to a signature bond in the amount of $500.00.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Bianca V., until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Due to victim notification, case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-28-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Shavarr R Patterson not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-9-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank for Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that due to the assignment of the ADA, this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BIANCA V.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
